OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: Ah, BLIP! Good to see you again!

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: Oh, this always happens. I guess your memory didn't survive the last one!

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: Not to worry! The user of this computer has requested a reboot. Maybe it crashed...

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: You are the Bits Logistics Implementation Program, or BLIP for short!

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: It's your job to give the right instructions to the reset button!

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: ...and the right instructions to every FILE along the way...

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: Well, let's get to it. Your base program has the CONVEYOR BELT and the MINER...

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: The FILE to the left will get us into the next area. Hover your cursor on it to see what it needs.

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: Should be easy, right? I mean, you're literally built for it...

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: How rude of me.. I'm RBG, the graphics, or something. Call me Arby!

Complete.Name: Arby
Complete.Text: Beep! Let's get to the next one!

Help1.Name: Arby
Help1.Text: You can select a building with your number keys, and rotate it with 'R' or 'Shift+R'.

Help2.Name: Arby
Help2.Text: Make a mistake? We all do! Press 'X' or 'Del' to enter deconstruct mode.

Help3.Name: Arby
Help3.Text: You can get out of build mode by pressing 'C'

OneShot.Name: BLIP
OneShot.Text: Wait a minute... how are you in two places at once?

OneShot.Name: Arby
OneShot.Text: This is a computer.. you've heard of 'Copy' and 'Paste,' haven't you?

Help1.Name: Arby
Help1.Text: Make sure you look at the arrows on top of the stacker.

Help2.Name: Arby
Help2.Text: The RIGHT input gets added to the end of the LEFT input..

Help3.Name: Arby
Help3.Text: Look how nice the refined bits are, compared to the dirty, raw bits.
